title: Roosters successfully defend National Rugby League title
text:
SYDNEY (AP) - The Sydney Roosters became the first team to successfully defend its National Rugby League title in nearly 30 years after claiming a controversial 14-8 grand final win over the Canberra Raiders on Sunday.

With the score tied at 8-8 in the 72nd minute, on-field referee Ben Cummins changed his mind on a decision to award six more tackles to the Raiders. One minute later, Roosters fullback James Tedesco scored the match-winning try by finishing off a 60-meter movement in front of a crowd of 82,982 spectators at Sydney's Olympic stadium.

The Roosters, who sent retiring halfback Cooper Cronk out a winner, took advantage of Cummins' decision to instead rule a turnover instead of six more tackles.

The Roosters scored off the next set of tackles, with Luke Keary running down the blind side and Latrell Mitchell producing a flick pass to unlock Daniel Tupou for Tedesco to score between the posts.

Cronk finished his career with victory in his ninth grand final.

"We showed heart and character and stuck in there and we grabbed our opportunity and we held on in the end," Roosters captain Boyd Cordner said.

The Brisbane Broncos were the last team to repeat as NRL champions in 1993.

___
